POINT OF ORIGINATION
Typical School Building Layout
Chesapeake and Potomac Telephone Company
To Classrooms
VHF TV Receivers
RF cable carries all signals from point of origin to all schools and then returns to point of
origin.
Point of Origin may be any one of locations: Board of Education, North Hagerstown High,
South Hagerstown High, Museum or Public Library.
Equalizing Networks and Broadband Amplifiers at approximately 1500 ft. intervals.
At the Board of Education, three simultaneous telecasts can be originated, or three teleÂ¬
casts may be originated simultaneously, from any one of the five origination points, and
the entire circuit will receive service for all telecasts.
Additional studios feed Channel 6 RF Transmitter*
As of January 16, 19577 the fol lowing distribution systems'arerin the circuit:
1 . Two High Schools 3. Washington County Museum of Fine Arts
2. Six Elementary Schools 4. Washington County Free Library
